alternatives.transcript: Hi, I'm Jacques Pepin and I'm cooking at home. This is a very, very easy bread that I want to show you how to make. And there is no kneading to it. What I'm going to have is a pound of flour. A pound of flour is 3 cups if you take it this way. That is, if you go directly into the banner of flour and take it like that, 3 cups will do a pound. If you were to sift it, you'd probably get close to 3 and a half cup. 2 and 3. Now with this, I have a teaspoon of salt here. And a teaspoon of yeast. Okay. I mix a little bit together and 1 and 3 quarter cup of water. It goes together. So it makes a very soft dough, softer than conventional bread dough, but it's a way of doing it. You see a very, That's about it. I will let it proof a couple of hours at room temperature. I'll cover it. Couple of hours is going to proof, you know, almost filling up the bowl, then we'll go to the second part. This is about 2 hours, 2, 2 and a half hours. It could be 3 hours. It depends entirely on where it is, the amount of heat in the kitchen, summer, winter. But as you can see, fill up the bowl, it's all bubbly on top. So I have my dough here, which I'm gonna break down. Okay. And then I put that onto a non-stick pan like this. I'm gonna oil it a little bit, like a good teaspoon of oil. I'm going to rub around. This is about 3 to 4 quart. This is about 3 to 4 quart. Okay, I'm going to cover it now and let it proof about 2-3 hours and cook it. Or you can put it in your refrigerator. Sometimes I do that in the afternoon. First proofing in the refrigerator. I get up in the morning, grab it from the refrigerator directly into the oven. So my bread is back here. I put that lid on top because that lid goes into the oven and I will start with the lid on. But it stay overnight in the refrigerator. And you can see the all bubbly here. And it basically full. 3 cup of flour, remember. So maybe I put a bit of flour on top. You don't have to. And that's it. I'm gonna put it into the oven, 425 degree. This is it, my bread is done. It cooks 30 minutes with the lid on, 30 minutes without the lid. And it's been out of the oven now for an hour or so. So it's just lukewarm. But, that's it. I have a Beautiful bread here. See what it look like inside. Nice and toasty. That's it. It's still warm. All I need is a piece of butter with this, and this is a very good fast bread. Try it. Happy cooking. ♪♪

paragraphs.transcript:
Hi, I'm Jacques Pepin and I'm cooking at home. This is a very, very easy bread that I want to show you how to make. And there is no kneading to it. What I'm going to have is a pound of flour. A pound of flour is 3 cups if you take it this way.

That is, if you go directly into the banner of flour and take it like that, 3 cups will do a pound. If you were to sift it, you'd probably get close to 3 and a half cup. 2 and 3. Now with this, I have a teaspoon of salt here. And a teaspoon of yeast.

Okay. I mix a little bit together and 1 and 3 quarter cup of water. It goes together. So it makes a very soft dough, softer than conventional bread dough, but it's a way of doing it. You see a very, That's about it.

I will let it proof a couple of hours at room temperature. I'll cover it. Couple of hours is going to proof, you know, almost filling up the bowl, then we'll go to the second part. This is about 2 hours, 2, 2 and a half hours. It could be 3 hours.

It depends entirely on where it is, the amount of heat in the kitchen, summer, winter. But as you can see, fill up the bowl, it's all bubbly on top. So I have my dough here, which I'm gonna break down. Okay. And then I put that onto a non-stick pan like this.

I'm gonna oil it a little bit, like a good teaspoon of oil. I'm going to rub around. This is about 3 to 4 quart. This is about 3 to 4 quart. Okay, I'm going to cover it now and let it proof about 2-3 hours and cook it.

Or you can put it in your refrigerator. Sometimes I do that in the afternoon. First proofing in the refrigerator. I get up in the morning, grab it from the refrigerator directly into the oven. So my bread is back here.

I put that lid on top because that lid goes into the oven and I will start with the lid on. But it stay overnight in the refrigerator. And you can see the all bubbly here. And it basically full. 3 cup of flour, remember.

So maybe I put a bit of flour on top. You don't have to. And that's it. I'm gonna put it into the oven, 425 degree. This is it, my bread is done.

It cooks 30 minutes with the lid on, 30 minutes without the lid. And it's been out of the oven now for an hour or so. So it's just lukewarm. But, that's it. I have a Beautiful bread here.

See what it look like inside. Nice and toasty. That's it. It's still warm. All I need is a piece of butter with this, and this is a very good fast bread.

Try it. Happy cooking. ♪♪

sentences.text: Hi, I'm Jacques Pepin and I'm cooking at home.
This is a very, very easy bread that I want to show you how to make.
And there is no kneading to it.
What I'm going to have is a pound of flour.
A pound of flour is 3 cups if you take it this way.
That is, if you go directly into the banner of flour and take it like that, 3 cups will do a pound.
If you were to sift it, you'd probably get close to 3 and a half cup.
2 and 3.
Now with this, I have a teaspoon of salt here.
And a teaspoon of yeast.
Okay.
I mix a little bit together and 1 and 3 quarter cup of water.
It goes together.
So it makes a very soft dough, softer than conventional bread dough, but it's a way of doing it.
You see a very, That's about it.
I will let it proof a couple of hours at room temperature.
I'll cover it.
Couple of hours is going to proof, you know, almost filling up the bowl, then we'll go to the second part.
This is about 2 hours, 2, 2 and a half hours.
It could be 3 hours.
It depends entirely on where it is, the amount of heat in the kitchen, summer, winter.
But as you can see, fill up the bowl, it's all bubbly on top.
So I have my dough here, which I'm gonna break down.
Okay.
And then I put that onto a non-stick pan like this.
I'm gonna oil it a little bit, like a good teaspoon of oil.
I'm going to rub around.
This is about 3 to 4 quart.
This is about 3 to 4 quart.
Okay, I'm going to cover it now and let it proof about 2-3 hours and cook it.
Or you can put it in your refrigerator.
Sometimes I do that in the afternoon.
First proofing in the refrigerator.
I get up in the morning, grab it from the refrigerator directly into the oven.
So my bread is back here.
I put that lid on top because that lid goes into the oven and I will start with the lid on.
But it stay overnight in the refrigerator.
And you can see the all bubbly here.
And it basically full.
3 cup of flour, remember.
So maybe I put a bit of flour on top.
You don't have to.
And that's it.
I'm gonna put it into the oven, 425 degree.
This is it, my bread is done.
It cooks 30 minutes with the lid on, 30 minutes without the lid.
And it's been out of the oven now for an hour or so.
So it's just lukewarm.
But, that's it.
I have a Beautiful bread here.
See what it look like inside.
Nice and toasty.
That's it.
It's still warm.
All I need is a piece of butter with this, and this is a very good fast bread.
Try it.
Happy cooking.
